case.state: So Emi, you're fast or something? Speed's crucial. Harder to hit fast opponents.
I can see you have your priorities in order, Emi.
Name's Shamir Nevrand. But keep your voice down. I'm in the alley for a contract. You don't mind if I join in on this game, do you? I need to blend in. Something to divert suspicions.
Name's Shamir Nevrand. But keep your voice down. I'm at this... strange location for a contract. You don't mind if I join in on this game, do you? I need to blend in. Something to divert suspicions.

Name's Shamir Nevrand. But keep your voice down. I'm on the roof to watch for my target listed in my contract. You don't mind if I join in on this game, do you? I need to blend in.

Name's Shamir Nevrand. But keep your voice down. I'm at the tiki bar on a contract. You don't mind if I join in on this game, do you? I need to blend in. Something to divert suspicions.
Name's Shamir Nevrand. But keep your voice down. I'm at The Inventory on a contract. You don't mind if I join in on this game, do you? I need to blend in. Something to divert suspicions.
Wait, "the professor?" Bernadetta, are you telling me Byleth sent you here? For the love of... We're gonna need Byleth's resignation...
"The professor"? Bernadetta, are you serious? Byleth should be fired, sending students here.
Hm? You're on a mission too, Gaige? That makes two of us.
A mission, huh? I'm supposed to be watching for a target. And you are... ?
You're on a mission too, huh? Seems like employers everywhere all had the same idea.
A zombie... Well, that at least clears you off my list of potential targets. Pretty sure the contract would have stated that much if my target was undead.
Joey? With that face paint... You almost remind me of Those Who Slither in the Dark. I trust you're unaffiliated. Don't worry.
Joey... Er, it's nothing. You just... You look like someone I know. Someone who did some very bad things. I apologize.
Kronya?! Oh, er, Joey? Right, my apologies.
Joey, was it? Just a heads up: you best be careful around people from Fódlan. You resemble someone very dangerous with that face paint.
You're eager, Brock. That's good. Although... Is that a hammer? With red spikes at the end? Why would the handle be... so close to... Huh?
Brock, right? Is that... a hammer? With red spikes? I take it you're meant to counter armored opponents.
Is that a hammer you're carrying? With red spikes? Ah, so you must counter armored opponents. Since I check fliers, I'd say we'd make a great team.
Byleth? Oh, my apologies. I know a professor by the academy by that name. Didn't take it for a common name.
Byleth? Oh, my apologies. I know a professor by the academy by that name. Didn't take it for a common name.
So, you're a champion of something, Cynthia? Don't let it get to your head. Champions need to eat and sleep like anyone else. That's when they're vulnerable.
So you're some kind of champion, Cynthia? People often make the mistake of thinking that just 'cause they earned some sort of title, it makes them untouchable. Watch out.
You a student, Maki? You're dressed like one. But you're not from Garreg Mach, are you...
You're a student, Maki? That doesn't look like the uniform at Garreg Mach...
I think there's some crests for dieting... You'll have to ask Hanneman about it.
If you want to lose weight, enroll in the Officer's Academy. We'll whip you in shape quick.
I'm to watch out for my target: a rebel serving Lonato. My employer works for the church. I don't know who they are, but they've sent me here with clear instructions.
I'll take ~cards~.
~Cards~ will do.
~Cards~.
~Cards~ will be fine.
Just ~cards~ this time.
~Cards~ this time.
How about ~cards~?
~Cards~, dealer.
Just these.
Ha! Got pretty lucky here to draw t---
Come on, just cause it's my birthday doesn't mean you have to spoil me with good cards.
Ha, wait until you see what I got, ~player~.
Did you use your magic to give me these cards, Tharja? I don't mind. Unless it's a bribe.
Yes. This is acceptable.
Nice. Love it when a good gamble pays off.
These are pretty nice.
A fairly nice hand.
Pretty nice hand, I would think.
This is good. I wish Catherine were here to see it.
At any rate, it's unlikely I'll lose with these.
Thanks dealer. The cards are appreciated.
This game may all come down to chance, but it's nice to think a good hand like this is a reflection of skill.
Strength is all for a mercenary.
Going for the kill.
Poker is better when shared with good company.
More weapons.
There's my opening.
I'm in.
Love it when a hand comes together.
I'll get Catherine back for this. That devil doesn't know what's good for her.
Should I let Lady Rhea know about this? This is such a misuse of the Church's funds, but... I can't betray Catherine like that.
Catherine won't get away with this. If this is how dirty she wants to play, then game on.
Catherine should be above sick jokes like this. I'll get her back for this one, just you watch.
Catherine's still at it with her games. That must be it. You'd think she'd wisen up all these years.
Feels good to fight for a cause.
I wouldn't be surprised if Catherine was hanging around here, watching. She's never been one to respect my privacy.
It wouldn't surprise me if Catherine was nearby, lurking in the shadows. She would follow me in the sauna's changing room to chat, but really, she does it to stare.
I might as well try to enjoy myself, I suppose. I mean, I'm almost enjoying things already...
I'm safe. For now.
Ha, things are looking good.
Hand doesn't look that bad.
These look alright.
Jackpot.
Bullseye.
Honestly, I should be doing other things on my birthday. It's rather unfortunate my contracts had to overlap with this one day out of the year.
It is my birthday today; but please, it's hardly important, Just treat it like any other day.
The twenty-seventh of Lone Moon is my birthday. That happens to be today. But don't make a big deal out of it. It's not important.
With Byleth running around in Smash, it's up to me and the other Knights of Seiros to teach her students.
With Byleth away at Smash, her students are now our responsibility... I don't mind it, but she didn't even stay a whole semester before leaving.
Byleth wasn't at the academy for a whole semester and already left for Smash. What did she think she was doing, agreeing to be a professor like that only to leave so soon?
Since Byleth left for Smash, it's been my duty to train her students. Isn't it strange? He becomes a professor for no more than a semester and is already leaving for some bigger party...
With Byleth running around in Smash, it's up to me and the other Knights of Seiros to teach his students.
With Byleth away at Smash, his students are now our responsibility... I don't mind it, but he didn't even stay a whole semester before leaving.
Byleth wasn't at the academy for a whole semester and already left for Smash. What did he think he was doing, agreeing to be a professor like that, only to leave so soon?
Since Byleth left for Smash, it's been my duty to train his students. Isn't it strange? He becomes a professor for no more than a semester and is already leaving for some bigger party...
You seem capable, ~player~. I may need your help subduing my targets should things go awry.
You don't look too bad, ~player~. It almost makes me excited to see if you'll lose the hand.
You have any obligations after the match, ~player~? I could take you to Garreg Mach. Show you around. Maybe spar a bit, if you're interested.
The more I'm around you, ~player~, the more attractive you seem. Think you're the type of person Catherine had in mind when she set me up for this to find a partner.
To hell with it, ~player~. Feel free to look at me while you do that. I don't mind.
To hell with it, ~player~. If you lose the match and have to masturbate, feel free to use me for inspiration. I don't mind.
Right then.
Taking aim.
There's nothing remarkable here.
Right. Let's get this done.
We should keep moving.
This could get interesting.
This is the sort of hand where skill really matters.
The key to gambling is knowing the situation better than your opponent.
After the Dagda and Brigid war, I traveled across Fódlan on my own. Lady Rhea took me in. I've owed her a debt ever since.
Yeah. This is fine.
It will have to suffice.
I'm a mercenary. I know how to make do.
It will work.
I've done better with less.
A new way to fight.
To work.
Stay vigilant.
Now that I know this was a ruse, I can dedicate my full attention to the game. I'll give it my all to not embarrass myself further.
If this is a setup, then I needn't worry about watching for any suspicious persons. I can focus solely on the cards.
I'll be focusing only on the cards from now on.
With my contract out of the way, I am now free of distractions. I will not be holding back.
I'm not seeing anyone suspicious... Maybe my employer got the wrong location?
Is it really necessary for me to play strip poker on the job? I could surely blend in some other way...
Catherine wants me here to find a new partner, I suppose... Should I just assume that's part two of the contract, or...
I do need to find a new partner, so I suppose being here isn't the worst thing in the world.
Trying to get the birthday girl in her birthday suit, I see.
Valentine's Day is a crock of shit, honestly. I'd rather spend it here than at Garreg Mach. Watching others engage in romance can be insufferable.
Valentine's Day can be a painful reminder to anyone without a date. It sucks.
Perhaps I should have stuck to more traditional mercenary work.
Perhaps I should have stuck to more traditional mercenary work for my coin.
Perhaps I should have stuck to more traditional mercenary work today.
Today just gets worse and worse.
Perhaps I should have stuck to more traditional mercenary work.
Perhaps I should have stuck to more traditional mercenary work for my coin.
Perhaps I should have stuck to more traditional mercenary work tonight.
Tonight just gets worse and worse.
Looks like I'm not having luck in my mission, nor my poker hand.
No target, no dice...
My eagerness for coin is perhaps a shortcoming. I must use this as a learning experience.
If only I had listened to my gut earlier, I could have avoided this whole mess.
I can't believe someone from the church would actually use our funding in this way...
Catherine is far wiser than I give her credit for if she truly is behind this whole scheme.
The years have treated Catherine's mind well if she's behind this scheme. I'll have to remember that when I get back at her.
Is Catherine truly behind this scheme? It's something she would do, but I can't help but imagine Claude helped devise the plan.
I wonder if Claude played a role in this scheme. Tricking me into stripping in front of others... It sounds like something he would do.
Catherine surely had assistance from Claude in this whole thing. He has a gift for scheming.
If Catherine truly is behind this scheme, then Claude may have a new rival...
Perhaps I'm not the only one with a bad hand.
It's a miss...
I've seen better days.
Sometimes, you get lucky. Sometimes, you don't.
A miss...
Like having a low luck stat...
Unlucky...
Perhaps there's someone else with an even worse hand.
Weeds must be cut at the root, like tyranny and vice.
Not every hand's a winner.
Where's a goddess icon when you need one?
(Think this... through...)
Can't say this is what I was hoping for.
It helps that I've had some liquor before playing...
My mission is very important, so I hope you'll forgive me if I keep to myself a bit. My target's description doesn't match either of you guys; so you're clear by me.
My mission is very important, so I hope you'll forgive me if I keep to myself a bit. My target's description doesn't match any of you guys; so you're clear by me.
You know, ~player~, you remind me somewhat of a friend of mine. A professor at the academy named Byleth. She's the quiet type, like you. We'll get along.
You know, ~player~, you remind me somewhat of a friend of mine. A professor at the academy named Byleth. He's the quiet type, like you. We'll get along.
I don't cook myself. Well, unless Professor Byleth asks. He loves cooking with his students.
I don't cook myself. Well, unless Professor Byleth asks. She loves cooking with her students.
Spare time is a luxury mercenaries aren't often afforded, Arash. If I'm not on a contract, I'm finding one.
Spare time is a foreign concept for Dagdans. I'm fortunate enough to live in Fódlan though. If I'm not on a contract, I'm practicing archery, Arash. Surely the same goes for you, no?
Favorite season? Probably the Ethereal Moon. What can I say? I enjoy judging the White Heron Cup.
Odd question. But if you must know, Arash, I'd visit Dagda. Been awhile since I've seen my countrymen.
My contracts often have me up passed midnight, Arash. Consistent sleeping schedule's aren't something I'm afforded in my line of work.
Depends on my work, Arash. I've had several contracts have me perform reconnaissance passed midnight.
Strange question to ask, Arash. A cautious woman like myself might take you for a thief scouting out the goods.
My choker, Arash. My lost lover gave it to me as a gift.
Dagda is known for it's diverse climate. I can handle anything from the humid southern jungles to the frozen plateaus in the north.
The White Heron Cup, Arash. It's a dancing competition during the Ethereal Moon that I judge with the other Knights.
My answer's the White Heron Cup, Arash. It's a dancing contest we hold in the winter. What can I say? Our students make great dancers.
Ha! Every night I'm with Catherine, Arash.
That's an easy one, Arash. You should meet Catherine. Woman can hold her liquor almost as well as I can.
Please, Arash. Catherine and I turn drinking into a contest.
You seem useful, Megumin. That's good. The useful people survive.
Here's a tip, Megumin: be yourself, but don't be irreplaceable. If you can't be replaced, you can't be promoted.
Honestly, you look better without the hat, Megumin. You're more cute. And delicate. Men like that sort of thing.
Guess you could call me that, Rainbow. I usually have a specific target in the contract, so it's up that that piece of paper where I go.
As I said, I won't take contracts that aren't approved from the Church of Seiros...... Fine, give me the details and I'll send them to Catherine for approval. What's the objective?
Men, women, zombies who refuse to call me by my name... It's all fair game, so long as there's a contract.
I haven't the slightest what you're on about, Tharja. But I'd appreciate it if you left me to my mission.
I've thought about your question earlier, Tharja. Beats me why they weren't more forthcoming with their identity. Probably embarrassed.
A paper trail? Oh... Well, sure, I suppose you're correct. That might seem a bit suspicious. But the mission is legitimate, despite that.
Ugh, I think you might be right, Tharja...
Catherine is an old friend of mine, Tharja. She's always been by my side. When my partner passed, I had considered asking to wed her, but... such partnerships are bad for business.
I'm in, Tharja. Let's get her back for this. But, first... Why would you help me?
Fine. Let's do it at the sauna tomorrow. You good for tomorrow, Tharja?
... I suppose you're right, Cynthia. As long as you let me focus on my contract when I need to.
So, Cynthia, there's some stuff a long time ago about Nemesis, The King of Liberation, and his battle against Seiros.
Right. Let's start with the Dagda-Brigid War. In 1175, the forces of Brigid and my homeland of Dagda invaded the Adrestian Empire...
It's a contract, Tharja. I was approached by someone from the Church. They handed me my orders. Said it was from one of the Knights of Seiros, but my employer's exact identity is unknown.
Yes.
Yeah. You heard right, Anna. Reconnaissance mission. Nothing too exciting.
Well, I am, Anna. At least as far as business goes. I play by the book. Make sure all my ducks are in a row.
And I said I wasn't interested, Anna.
I've done it all. Body-guarding. Assassinations. Reconnaissance. Smuggling. My resumé is impeccable; I'm the best in the business.
Honestly, Anna, I think you're right. He hasn't shown up yet and I don't think he will.
We're more than friends, Anna. We're basically inseparable. Hell, we've talked about the idea of getting married. Ultimately, Catherine thinks I'd be better off with a man.
No crime, Anna. If you think I would agree to breaking the law, you have me mistaken.
Forget setting up a contract, Anna. I can step away for a few hours to escape to a pub.
Assassination wasn't in the contract, Miko. It's just reconnaissance. But I'm ultimately left to use my judgment should things go awry.
Shame? What is... Oh, you're talking about me... Name's Shamir, Saki. And yes, I have to target to watch for. So stay out of my way.
What is this? My fourth loss? My fifth? And yet, still no sign of my target. Something isn't right.
So I'm the first loser. A damn shame for sure. But it helps when you just want this to be done with.
This farce can't end soon enough.
Another loss? Hmm. Right. I'll try not to make it a habit.
And while distracted, I lost.
Didn't earn my keep...
Curses... It can be tough to focus on two things at once.
I suppose I'm not as talented at multitasking as I'd have liked to believe.
Is this necessary? I'll strip if I must.
Another loss, hm? Regrettable.
Again? I'm starting to lose count...
Silence.
If you insist.
Sleep in the dirt.
(Sleep in the dirt, Catherine).
Didn't earn my keep...
I'm confident that sly fox Catherine put me up to this. She's always been good at taking jokes too far.
I fancy myself a bit of revenge. Catherine won't be getting away with this.
A loss? Oh, right. My apologies. I was so absorbed on the contract that I forgot to focus.
Oh, right. The poker game. To be honest, it slipped my mind we were even playing. That happens when you're focusing on more important things.
Ah, right. The poker game. My apologies, everyone. I was on the lookout for my target.
Right, the poker match. Completing the contract is more important than this game, but perhaps I should focus more on the cards regardless.
I suppose it's rude to the game host if I don't follow the rules.
It's one of the reasons I suspect her, Anna. If she wants me to find love with a man, what better way than have me play this disgusting game. She undoubtedly expected some men to be playing.
It's one of the reasons I suspect her, Anna. If she wants me to find love with a man, what better way than have me play this disgusting game. She undoubtedly knew some men would be playing.
I haven't, Miko, and I'm curious why you'd attempt to out yourself as my target. The contract explicitly stated my target was male, Miko. So what are you after?

Listen, I don't know who you're after, Miko, but I don't work for free. And I also don't accept contracts that aren't approved by the church. Speak with Catherine at Garreg Mach if you wish to hire me.
That's correct, Saki. I play by the book. Some call it being strict. I call it job security.

My only client is the Church of Seiros, Saki. All contracts must be approved by the Knights. As for my targets... Only knights and nobles so far. There was a contract to take out a Lord, but Catherine took it herself.
Perhaps you've never heard of "Don't ask, don't tell", Tharja. We have a name for a mercenary who asks questions. We call them unemployed.
Ha, tell me about it, Tharja. You could drown in all of the paper work. Contracts aren't official unless everything is in order.
Huh? Wait-, but... Well, when you put it that way...
I suppose there is no target, is there? It's a setup, as you said. Now that you mention it, it just makes too much sense.
It's something like a game, I'm sure. No doubt she's been scheming this up for weeks. But, she also really cares about me. She really does want me to find love, Tharja.
I don't want to hurt her, Tharja. Do you have anything that's safe?
Five works, Tharja. Catherine and I usually go to the sauna in pairs. We've seen each other nude countless times, so it's not a big deal for us.
Homeland? Dagda, or Fódlan?
Nah. Not worth getting into, Cynthia. The real interesting stuff is about the Houses of Fódlan and the royal families.
The war was one-sided. House Von Bergliez aided the Adrestian Empire and swiftly put down the invasion of my peoples.
I could have chosen not to accept this mission, but the pay's good. I just have to play this game to blend in while I watch for a target, Tharja.
Can't.
You're nosy, Anna. That's not a good thing. And no, I won't tell you how much I'm getting paid.
You have... work for me? Sorry, Anna. I appreciate it, but I serve the Church of Seiros. I owe Archbishop Rhea a debt. Any contracts I take will be on behalf of the Church.
If you care that much, Anna, then yes, that's the proper course of action. I won't disappear on the Knights without them approving my absence.
Cheap... scheme? Anna, what are you talking about?
To be honest, I had a feeling it might be a setup. The pay was too good for the contract; that was the first indicator. But when the pay is that good, it's hard to pass it up.
Sleight of hand? Well... yeah, I know a few tricks. So, what, you want to prance into a tavern and make some bets? That sort of thing?
I'll just tell Catherine I'm going out with a friend. Shouldn't be but a few hours.
I'm sent here to play this game, meet people, and strip. "It's part of the contract! You need to blend in to locate the target". Except, there is no target, is there?
Being the first to do this is... It's regrettable, really.
I had hoped someone else would have to do this before me. Suppose that was asking for too much.
It was too much to hope someone else would have to do this before me. Whatever, I guess. I just want this whole thing to be over.
My quiver was made in Dagda. The Knights of Seiros use standard issue equipment, but Lady Rhea allowed an exception with my quiver.
My quiver may look strange. That's because it was made in Dagda. It's a unique piece. Custom-made.
This quiver is important to me. My old partner I've long since lost made this for me...
Like the quiver? One of a kind. My partner got it commissioned from a smith in Dagda.
I like thin gloves. Thicker gloves don't allow me to handle my bow properly.
I like thin gloves. I'm prone to fumble with my arrows if my gloves are too thick.
I wear thin gloves. Could you imagine trying to aim a bow with half an inch of padding under your fingers?
I find thinner gloves to serve me more properly. Deftness is a necessity in my line of work.
You know, it's much easier to watch for suspicious activity while someone else is doing the stripping.
It's harder to pay attention to my contract while I'm the one stripping. I suppose that's just motivation to focus, right?
It's difficult to watch for my target while taking off my boots. For the sake of the mission, I cannot allow any more losses.
Stripping? I can handle that.
It may seem strange, but I'll be taking off my corsage now.
No, I'll take off my corsage first...
I'd like my choker on a while longer. So, I'll choose my corsage.
If I'm correct, this garment is called a corset where most people are from. In my land, the language is a little different.
The term corsage seems to be becoming more and more dated. Sounds like corset is being more widely used. Still, what's the difference...
It sounds like corset seems to be gaining popularity. But in Fódlan, the term corsage is still used.
This choker means a lot to me... It was a gift from an old partner... I never take this off.
This choker has more value to me than you could imagine. It was a gift from my first love...
This is it. My last item...
This situation just went from bad to worse. Just pretend you walked in on me changing...
I bet this is the kind of thing Catherine wanted...
I hope Catherine's happy about all of this. And I especially hope it's worth the payback she's getting.
Some orders are harder to follow than others.
Having to take off my jacket... It's a shame I can't refuse this order.
This whole game is just a bunch of orders. You'd think I'd be better at it.
Orders orders orders. That's all I ever seem to do. Following orders...
Taking off my jacket is more than I was hoping to do. Dammit.
Well, with any luck, there's still a chance I can win...
What's the next step? It's easy if I have orders to follow.
For your own benefit, Miko, I'll leave out the part where it sounds like you're threatening Garreg Mach. Catherine would reject your contract outright.
... Pictures? Miko, you want me to break into someone's home and paint pictures of them? I can barely make a stick figure.
Thanks, Saki. Fair coin is just that. If you have any... zombie friends, do tell them to stay clear of me at work. I'd hate to take down a friendly by mistake.
Nothing too big, I hope. This contract... It may well lead to full-scale rebellion. Hope it doesn't come to that. But, wages are wages.
... Allow me a moment to think about it, Tharja. But I don't see any value in this exercise.
Ugh, can you just get to the point already, Tharja?
A... a setup?

No. Honestly, I suspect it was Catherine. She's one of the Knights of Seiros I work with. She's always telling me I need to find love, even if it means "putting myself out". She set this up, no doubt.
What do you mean, Tharja? Assist me in getting her back... Hmmmmmm... I'll have to think about this.
Seriously, Tharja, how would I have that kind of information?
I think we should just stick with the one spell for now...

scene.name: Overview
scene.directive: After the game of strip poker, a robed figure emerges from the corner of The Inventory. Shamir briefly catches a faint shine from his cloak. It's the sigil of Lord Lonato.

Shamir was still naked from the game when the figure started to flee. Shamir wasted no time; she hurried to get dressed. Without thinking, you hand her her bow and chase after the figure, who was undoubtedly Shamir's target.

Your chase takes you to the woods. You navigate the unruly terrain for a couple of hours with Shamir hot on your heels. Without thinking of the consequences, you embark on your journey to help Shamir complete her contract. Little did you know what lewd adventures awaited you.

scene.name: Catch up
scene.directive: He went west, but I don't see any signs of trespass. No footprints. No broken twigs. No scattered leaves...
But at this rate, there's no telling how far west he went. He could be on the coast by now.
Let's catch our breath for a minute. We'll be more efficient if we wait for our stanima to come back.
Uh, Shamir? ... You are certain you saw Lord Lonato's sigil on his cloak, right?
Why are you chasing after my target with me?
What's going on between the Knights of Seiros and that rat bastard rebel is none of your concern.
You are unaffected by any of it and you gain no reward if I succeed.
So, why are you helping me?
I... I haven't thought about it.
I mean I haven't thought about it. I saw you alarmed at the man in robes and you shouted something, and...
And I just kind of ran...
I won't have the lives of innocent people caught in the crossfire of this feud between the Church and Lord Lonato.
This doesn't concern you, ~player~. Getting involved, it... it'll only make things worse.
That's not true, Shamir. Your enem-
This is Lord Lonato's territory. If any of his men spot us here, we'll have a fight on our hands. And I'm only one sniper.
Sure, I could take a few of the bastards down before they get me, but Lord Lonato has an entire army at his disposal.
You need to turn back, ~player~. I'll take you to the a. Monastery.
What, you're just going to give up like that? We'll never get another chance like this again.
Taking down Lord Lonato is the business of the Knights of Seiros.
Folk like you shouldn't trouble yourselves in such matters. You're only putting yourself in danger.
We're heading back, ~player~. Before it's too late.

scene.name: Got Shot
scene.directive: Immense pain takes over. You feel a sharp pulse consume your right thigh.
You fall on your knees, then to the ground. Your eyes are closed, wincing in pain. Something irritates your thigh as you lay on your belly.
You hear Shamir, yelling. You hear a rustle in nearby bushes, followed by footsteps. They grow distant, as if fading into silence.
The rough Earth irritates your stomach, but it pales in comparison to the pain in your thigh. It grows more intense. It starts to feel warm.
You consider getting back on your feet, but the pain overwhelms you. You feel yourself slipping.
The last thing you think of as you lose consciousness

scene.name: Awakening
scene.directive: You slowly adjust to your new surroundings. You're lying on the ground, naked from the waist down with only a towel over your crotch for modesty.
A campfire blazes to your right. You seem to be at a sort of make shift camp.
A pain still takes over your upper thigh, but it's managable.
What happened? How long have I been out?
You could have gotten both of us killed, you know?
I'm... I'm sorry. Can you please start from the beginning?
You got shot in the thigh with an arrow.
It came from the bushes. Pretty sure it was a woman. One of Lord Lonato's snipers, no doubt.
I returned fire, but she was quick in her retreat. I pursued for a minute, but I suspected she was leading me into an ambush, so I doubled back.
You were already unconscious by the time I returned. The area wasn't safe, so I carried you east for a mile or two before setting down.
Your wound was pretty bad, ~player~. Your upper, inner thigh. There wasn't any other way I could tend to it without removing your pants, so that's what I did.
Hope you're not too mad about that.
Oh, so... That's why my pants are off...
It was either that or let your wound go untreated!
You're not very light, you know.
But, anyway. That wound is still at risk of an infection.
While you were out, I scouted the area for medicine leaves. I already have the remedy prepared.
Now, hold still. I'm going to apply it really quick. Then we can get out of here.
You straighten up. Shamir tended to your wounds before? That means...
That means she took your pants off and treated your inner thigh... Just mere inches away from...
You try to fight your body. You try to supress your body's response.
Don't be ridiculous. Time is of the essence.
That sniper could be back any minute.
Th-that's not... what I mean is...
It's the natural response of a human male.
How is the wound coming along?
Doesn't look like it'll get infected.
Yes. I need better access to the wound.
Move your dick to the left.
You want me to move my... dick? T-t-
That's just the body's natural response...
Please excuse me. I need to clean myself off.
(I didn't close my mouth soon enough. I need to get this taste out too...)

scene.name: To Be Continued
scene.directive: Hello! This concludes Act I of Shamir's epilogue. More will hopefully be coming, but I can make no guarantees. Please view Shamir's epilogue as complete, because it is possible Act II and onwards may not happen. Act I is satisfactory as a stand alone epilogue anyway, so please view possible additional Acts as bonus.
